transcripts.text: Sorry fidgeting fidgeting.  Explain to us.
Paul was hurt was playing through it.  He did miss some games but his however limited he was.

how much did that limit you guys as a team?  and I think any of the small details that you can think of have probably more than likely affected the team in one way or another.  You know what I mean?  Butterfly effect almost sort of thing, you know?  But again, it's still one of those things like obviously it ain't an excuse.  If you say you're good enough to play, then you still got to come out and play.  And that's just rule of thumb across the board, mate.  Even for you guys, if you say you're good enough to work, mate, you got to show up to meet the standard of what you're going to work at, you know?  And, you know, that's just reality of it, regardless.  Is there a feeling that you have right now that you should be able to expand your game offensively at all?  or is it still a waste of possession in your mind?  It still is because it's still my role to do what I'm doing, if that makes sense.  Mid-range and three-pointers aren't in that.  So I would say that it still is a thing.  I could develop it.  Great.  But then, you know, that's just for individual, you know, gain or whatever it is.  Again, for the team, you still have to just focus on what you think, well, what your role is.  And I was really trying to just lock down on those things, you know.  But if I get the word and they're like, hey, mate, Jack a couple threes and it's like, no worries, mate.  Get in the gym.  Yeah.

Steven, my understanding of one of your roles is defense, obviously your role in the defense, and I have something similar to Paul.  The way the league is changing with so many teams shooting so many threes, how much more difficult is it becoming to play good defense in this league, and how tough did you see that sort of go as the season went?

How hard is it to play?  How much harder now with the three-point shot just becoming even more of a... a weapon in this league.  That's tough.  I think the tough thing is that when the league just brings out the new rules, then we have to adjust.  I guess this year, the grabbing thing, these all play a huge part in just a three-point shot.  These fouls that they're calling now if it's just this.  Each of those little things I think play more of a factor.  then I guess just someone shooting a three.  Yeah, because again, that leads to fouls.  They get a free throw line earlier.  More points just start snowballing from there.  Yeah.  We see you chasing guards on.
Which is a lot.

I mean, you do it, but that can't be easy, is it?  No, it's not easy.  And, I mean, that's just the way it is.  I mean, with our defense, I mean, I've done it since rookie season.  It'll be a bit more so now.  Like I said, I mean, a lot of people are hunting for threes.  You don't really see the point guards who are just straight downhill, constantly downhill.  So, I mean, I'm doing more reps now.  And I guess, like, the workload is a bit more tougher.  But, I mean, it's still strategy remains the same.  Yeah.  Get a treatment.  Are you feeling more comfortable with the ball coming to you directly and then becoming a facilitator or attacking yourself?  Do I feel more comfortable?  Yeah, like as time goes on in that role.  Yeah, I mean, yeah.  Obviously, yeah, the more you do it, obviously, you feel a bit more comfortable and whatnot.  But, yeah, I feel fine with it, bro.

You have to push yourself more to do it?  I mean, because you do all the other things.  Is that to be more assertive on that offensive end?  They do give it in post.  You have to remind yourself to go ahead and you can get yours, so to speak.

I think I know what you're asking.  You're basically saying to go to school or something?  Yeah, I mean, you're just talking about to just go score it myself, yeah?  I mean, yeah.  I don't know, yeah, I guess I do, but it's, yeah, I like to just have a successful play.  That's just the bottom line of it.  And, you know, sometimes it is me scoring.  But then, you know, a lot of times it's like kicking it out to whoever, guards cutting or whatever it is.  So, I mean, that's all I'm trying to push myself to do is more just what is the right play as opposed to what do I need, like, I need to score this ball.  You know what I mean?  I don't think it's a confidence thing.  It's just more just, I think, my obsession with trying to get a successful play for that position.  English?  Just gave me no nod of approval anyway.  Steven, I think Billy and Sam have talked about y'all doing something quite fast this season.  It did look like y'all were getting shots up earlier in the shot clock.  Does that pertain to you two as well?  If you get a ball in the post, going up quicker with a move, is that something that plays into that as well?  No.  Not at all.  Now, sorry, we'll say if you're talking about the rim runs, if I catch you, like, if it's, you know... If you're in just, like, a half-court set... Yeah.  Half-court set, no.  I think that what they were mentioning more is just, like, us getting out on the break and then, like, kind of try and take advantage of any sort of mismatches that we may have or just if they're even not in load help or scramble situations.  I think they're talking about that more so.  You might be right, though, bro, but, like, yeah.  To your question, it doesn't affect me if I'm trying to, like, oh, he said to score it within this many seconds.  Let me throw this up real quick.  Like, no, it's more just, yeah, I think it's more just attacking any mismatches, kind of get them in scramble, no load or whatever.  I think it's more so that.  Did you feel like there was a hesitance on your part this season when it came down low because of the free throw situation?  Because you didn't shoot free throws particularly well this year.  Did you feel like there was a hesitance on offense in terms of going up, absorbing contact and getting to the free throw line?  No, I don't think so.  I mean, you know, going up, I mean, there's still, even though I missed them, there's still the huge benefit of getting fouled, which is being, you know, the team fouls and whatnot, even if you shoot it bad.  I mean, if I look at analytics too, it's still points per position.  It still probably works out relatively well.  And you see a lot of teams not actually fouling, doing that whole foul thing anymore.  I'm not sure.  I'm just going by what I'm seeing when I'm playing.  It's just like, you know, they don't seem to be targeting a player and just fouling them.  I'm not sure if it's to do with that or not.  But yeah, me with me, mate, I'm just like trying to go up regardless of the free throws.  Because again, it's still a huge benefit.  be even more of a benefit if I made it, if I make them, you know, that's like the best thing, but still, there's still some good benefit as opposed to me just like not being aggressive.  Now, if I'm not aggressive and whatnot, then yeah, that's a bad thing, but I don't think I wasn't doing what you were saying, like I was trying to go up and get contact and whatnot, yeah.
What's your goals in the off-season?

I know you just finished up, but what do you want to work on this summer and What is your summer going to be like?  I don't know mate, honestly it's just same stuff.  Get with them, still figure out roughly what the role is.  Not figure it out, sorry, just like go into detail what you need to work on, watch some film, going into it and then yeah, just develop it from there.  If that makes sense for the team.  Team role.  This guy's approval is amazing.  Just give me a nod.
That's what it takes.
Just give me a nod, man.

Early in your career and even recently, you look like a guy that's constantly getting in-game feedback from the coaching staff and getting instruction from the coaching staff.  And you appear to be really technical at it and trying to do exactly what they tell you to do.  Is that something you've always done?  Is that something you thought continued even to this season?

Yeah, I think I've always been like that, just because, again, the perspective of what I'm seeing is a lot different from what even you guys are watching, you know what I mean?  So, I mean, obviously I always try and just get their advice, see what they're seeing.  I mean, I could feel, I could think, like, oh, this is what I look like and this is what I'm feeling, but, again, what is actually happening is I might not even be doing that, if that makes sense, yeah.  like.  so that's why i always try and like talk to the coaches and be like bro am i am i i feel like i'm up on the pick and roll and am i back?  like two things like yes you need to be higher like just the littlest details and that's all i try and try and get.  or if there's a play again i go to the scouting dude.  whoever did the scout make sure that you know if i heard a call um just Relay it back to them, like, yo, what is that?  They'll just tell me whatever it is and I'll try and relay it to the boys just so they can kind of anticipate it.  Help out with the play a bit more.
How common is that throughout the league?  Because I don't see a lot of guys actually doing that.

Yeah, I'm the only one.  I'm a genius.  I'm a genius.  No, no, no, everyone bloody does it, mate.  Honestly, it's just like, it really depends on just if you guys are looking for it, mate.  It looked like you had a keen eye for it, so you spotted it.  But if you watch some other team, you'll probably see a bunch of them do it too.  So, yeah, I'll still take credit for it, though.

The same thing with officials.  It seems like you have a similar approach to talking to officials and figuring out what... Obviously, I could be hearing the wrong thing, but what is your approach when you're talking to officials?

I'm just seeing what they... Just seeing what they see, you know what I mean?  Just because, I mean, it's the same exact thing.  I felt like I was in, say, a legal position.  he'll tell me what he saw and that's how I interpreted it and I was like, okay, I'll try not to do it again.  That's pretty much always been my approach.  I wouldn't say always, it's a bit of a rager before, yeah, a bit of a rager, but then I just learn to just change it.  because again, I mean, they're trying to call the game how they see it and I'm just trying to figure out, because every ref is different and they're in different positions, so I'm just trying to not make the same mistake.  So yeah, try and get advice from them too, best I can.  Assuming that he has sent you something, have you responded to any potential in-scanner trash-talking texts?  Oh, trash talk?  Nah, not trash talk.  It was all... Yeah, I think for the most part it was all love.  Unless there's, like, some, like, weird, hidden English, like, code that I don't know about.  He's just, like, a hidden joke.  But, yeah, it seemed pretty decent, yeah.  What do you think about them introducing it as in Turkish?  That's nice, yeah.  That's nice.  yeah it's real good it's just.  it's just a good little thing.  again like when you um i don't know just speaks a little differently.  you know.  um you know it may not mean anything to anyone else but for him i know it's a huge Huge thing for him.  I'm not sure if another team did that for him.  So, I mean, it's really cool, and it's cool to hear, but I just couldn't change it.  Just like when we do it with Spanish, there's a, what does it say, Al Thunder on our t-shirts or something?  Yeah, so when they introduce us in Spanish, it's cool.  It's cool.  I feel pretty cool.  I feel pretty great.  Josh Eustace is still the best one, though.  I was like, Josh, who is this?  LAUGHTER Gold, mate.  Gold.

Steven, as you guys exit this season, do you think you guys leave thinking you let it sort of get away from you post-All-Star break playoffs?  Or, you know, Paul's hurt, kind of dealt a bad hand, gave it your best shot between those.  Or another story.  I mean, what's the narrative?

I don't know amongst the lads.  I'm not sure, but.  For me personally, it's pretty much all the above, mate.  Mostly the first one.  The whole objective right from the get-go is to win a championship.  Anything short of that is kind of hard to be like, oh, yeah, we did okay.  But that's just for me personally.  Because you set out, this is the objective, you didn't get the objective done.  That's how I see it.  Now, again, with other people, it could be different, man.  I'm not speaking on their behalf.  It's just me.
Was the team in a good place internally through those trials?  Were you guys still together?  And was the locker room good?  Those sorts of things.

Yeah, absolutely.  We're sticking together and all that.  And again, you always have got to go in there and just try and figure out a solution.  Everyone's trying to do the right thing.  That's what's good with the type of players we have.  It's good from Sam's part too.  They're good locker room guys.  And when they go out there, they ain't trying to be selfish.  They ain't trying to... do bad or whatever.  They're really actually trying to represent Oklahoma quite well.  So then they go out there and try and play with a really good mindset and try and figure out how we're going to win as opposed to how I'm going to get mine.  We don't have that problem at all, which is nice.  It's good.  But again, you can still feel that you've still got to solve the problem.  It's all good being nice guys and all that sort of stuff.  You've still got a job at hand, you know.  Even in your mind, given that you said the championship is the goal every year and you have guys who are adaptable and want to win, what's preventing it in your mind?  What's the next step for you guys?  I don't know, mate.  There's no one answer.  There's too many answers.  So, yeah.  Yeah, there's just too many answers, mate.  I'd rather not.  I'd rather not.  because then you put too much emphasis on it you know.  so it's not one of those things.  it's like they all each play a role even if it's the smallest piece that's affecting it.  that still has just as much of an impact as another reason if that makes sense.  so yeah that'll do mate that'll do.

We talked a little with Paul and Ray about specifically Terrence and his movement from year two to year three, and they're saying for them that was a really important year.  Is that, in your experience, was two to three a big year for development?

For you.  Oh, for me.  Oh, so you're saying that for them two and three was a big year?  Um, yeah, I think so.  Uh, was it a big year for me?  Uh, I think so.  I think, but I think every year is, it's, it's one of those weird ones.  I mean, you can look back on it like, yay, like that one was pretty cool, but I guess like, you know, it's one of those weird ones where like the first year, if I haven't gone through any of that, may not have did this or yada, yada, yada, blah, blah, blah, wits, wits, wits.  It's not anything.  No, not me.  Not for me anyway.  Maybe some of the other fellas.  Anybody else?  Last one.
I think Billy went...

I think Billy went small that fourth quarter against Portland and you were on the bench.  What do you think about scenarios like that where Jeremy goes to the five and you've got to watch you guys basically lose the series while you're on the bench?  I mean, it's fine.  I mean, again, like, we could... I thought it put us in a position to win the series, you know.  I'm not saying, like, it's this weird thing, like, you know, just because I'm in the game doesn't mean... you know, still going to have the same outcome.  Yeah, I mean, like, it's still, but, like, again, like, Burley thought that that was the best decision for the time.  I thought it was actually working really well, to be honest.  And so that's just how it was.  There was no real disappointment, apart from, obviously, losing the game.  But I think, like, this weird thing, like, I should have been playing.  It's not that at all.  Again, your time on the court, it's not a given.  and it shouldn't be expected.  You know what I mean?  The coach needs to feel like that, you know, put whatever piece he feels that's going to win us the game.  So, I mean, I don't go in there expecting to play.  You know, whatever time he does give me, so you've got to go in there and just give it your all in that time.  So I think more so since we lost the game, it's more how I could have done, what I could have done better with the time that I was already on there as opposed to, oh, I would have did this better.  Yeah.  There you go.  See that, mate?  That's the approval.  Fucking old mate, eh?  Thank you.
